attributes.text:
Container widget for internal frames (iframes). An iframe can display any HTML page inside the widget.

Example

Here is a little example of how to use the widget.

var document = this.getRoot();
var iframe = new qx.ui.embed.Iframe("http://www.qooxdoo.org");
document.add(iframe);

External Documentation

Documentation of this widget in the qooxdoo wiki.
URL which should initally set.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property nativeContextMenu.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeContextMenu}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property scrollbar.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollbar}.

Creates

element which is aligned over iframe node to avoid losing mouse events.
Blocker element node
Native load event
Reacts on native load event and redirects it to the widget.
The event object
Stops the contextmenu event from showing the native context menu

Checks if the iframe element is out of sync. This can happen in Firefox if the iframe is moved around and the source is changed right after. The root cause is that Firefox is reloading the iframe when its position in DOM has changed.
Cover the iframe with a transparent blocker div element. This prevents mouse or key events to be handled by the iframe. To release the blocker use {@link #release}.

Returns the (computed) value of the property nativeHelp.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeHelp}.
(Computed) value of nativeHelp.

Returns the (computed) value of the property scrollbar.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollbar}.
(Computed) value of scrollbar.
Initial value for property nativeHelp.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property nativeHelp with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeHelp}.
the default value
Initial value for property scrollbar.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property scrollbar with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollbar}.
the default value

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property nativeHelp equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeHelp}.
Whether the property equals true.
Release the blocker set by {@link #block}.

Resets the user value of the property nativeHelp.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeHelp}.

Resets the user value of the property scrollbar.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollbar}.
New value for property nativeHelp.

Sets the user value of the property nativeHelp.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeHelp}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property scrollbar.

Sets the user value of the property scrollbar.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #scrollbar}.
The unmodified incoming value.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property nativeHelp.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #nativeHelp}.
the new value

Whether to show the frame’s native context menu.

Note: This only works if the iframe source is served from the same domain as the main application.

If the user presses F1 in IE by default the onhelp event is fired and IE’s help window is opened. Setting this property to false prevents this behavior.

Note: This only works if the iframe source is served from the same domain as the main application.
Whether the widget should have scrollbars.
